alert.note: Alert for Northwestern Nye County (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued February 23 at 1:46PM PST until February 25 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Elko
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM FRIDAY TO 4 AM PST SATURDAY... ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM SATURDAY TO 4 AM PST SUNDAY... * WHAT...For the Blizzard Warning, blizzard conditions expected. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 10 inches for the valleys. Heavy snow, winds gusting as high as 60 mph, will cause zero visibility due to blowing and drifting snow. For the Winter Storm Warning, heavy snow expected. Further snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches in the valleys. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph causing reductions to visibility due to blowing and drifting snow. Valleys total snowfall through whole event of 8 to 18 inches with snow drifts several feet deep. Mountains can see 1 to 3 feet of snowfall through whole event. * WHERE...Northwestern Nye County. * WHEN...For the Blizzard Warning, from 10 AM Friday to 4 AM PST Saturday. For the Winter Storm Warning, from 4 AM Saturday to 4 AM PST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Travel is expected to very difficult to impossible. Widespread blowing snow with significantly reduce visibility to white out conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Very strong winds could cause tree damage.
info.instruction: Travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
